content: Singaporean politicianThis article **is missing information** about this person's life, found in history texts and journals. Please expand the article to include this information. Further details may exist on the talk page. *(February 2016)* **Chor Yeok Eng** [PJG](/wiki/Pingat_Jasa_Gemilang) ([Chinese](/wiki/Chinese_language): 曹煜英; [pinyin](/wiki/Pinyin): *Cáo Yùyīng*; [Jyutping](/wiki/Jyutping): *Cou4 Juk1 Jing1*; [Pe̍h-ōe-jī](/wiki/Pe%CC%8Dh-%C5%8De-j%C4%AB): *Chô Io̍k-eng*; 29 January 1930 – 21 July 2016) was a Singaporean politician who is one of the "[Old Guard](/wiki/Central_Executive_Committee_(PAP)#Old_Guard)" members of the [People's Action Party](/wiki/People%27s_Action_Party) (PAP). ## Political career Chor served two separate stints in [Parliament](/wiki/Parliament_of_Singapore). He was first elected in 1959 as the member of the [Legislative Assembly of Singapore](/wiki/Legislative_Assembly_of_Singapore) for the [Jurong Single Member Constituency](/wiki/Jurong_Single_Member_Constituency) but was defeated in 1963. He also served as Parliamentary Secretary for the [National Development](/wiki/Ministry_of_National_Development_(Singapore)) from 1961 to 1963. Between 1963 and 1966, he served as Political Secretary for Health. Chor was [elected](/wiki/1966_Singaporean_by-elections) as a member of the [Parliament of Singapore](/wiki/Parliament_of_Singapore) for [Bukit Timah Single Member Constituency](/wiki/Bukit_Timah_Single_Member_Constituency) serving from 1966 to 1984. He also served as Parliamentary Secretary for [Health](/wiki/Ministry_of_Health_(Singapore)) from 1966 to 1972 and Senior Parliamentary Secretary for [Environment](/wiki/Ministry_of_the_Environment_and_Water_Resources) for 1972 to 1982. Chor was the Chairman of People's Action Party Bukit Timah Branch in 1979. ## Personal life Chor has three daughters, two sons, three grandsons and two great-grandsons. In 2015, Chor was diagnosed with [aplastic anemia](/wiki/Aplastic_anemia). He died on 21 July 2016 at [Singapore General Hospital](/wiki/Singapore_General_Hospital). ## Honours and awards - 1990 [Meritorius Service Medal](/wiki/Pingat_Jasa_Gemilang) ## Bibliography - Lam, Peng Er and Tan, Kevin (Ed.) (2000). *Lee's lieutenants : Singapore's old guard*. Singapore: Allen & Unwin. [ISBN](/wiki/ISBN_(identifier)) 1-86508-172-8 This article about a politician from Singapore is a stub. You can help Wikipedia by expanding it. - v - t - e
title: Chor Yeok Eng
